intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. pseudoramosum, commonly known as the false branched hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Hieracium. The subspecies is distinguished by its more robust growth and the presence of shorter, less branched stems compared to other members of the species. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies in its native range.
